result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacek A Martinez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court orders defendant to pay all costs, fees, and surcharges, including DNA surcharge at a rate of $50.00 monthly, commencing 2/1/2015 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept. Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
Consecutive to: 
Any other sentence, with credit for 1 day served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacek A Martinez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jacek A Martinez in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Court reviewed the report.    The defendant has complied with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.
On motion of the state, the court amended the charge to Possession of THC, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 961.41(3g)(e), a class U misdemeanor.   Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction to the amended charge.

Court sentenced defendant to serve 1 DAY in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 1 day served; TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court orders defendant to pay all cost, fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge at a rate of $50.00 monthly, commencing 2/1/2015 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Court denies defense request for expungement.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form.
Deferred Prosecution Agreement Progress report, received and filed. lms

Defendant Jacek A Martinez in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Defendant has attended all appointments and tested negative.  Defendant needs to begin community service.  Defendant is on the wait list for Thinking For Change.  Review hearing scheduled for January 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  lms
Conditions of signature bond amended:  POSSESS NO FIREARMS.

Defendant Jacek A Martinez in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Patricia Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Kolberg).  Filed, signed Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  The court reviewed the Agreement with the defendant.  
The defendant was advised of his/her constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry.
The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and found it to be in the best interest of the parties and the general public.
Case adjourned to for review hearing in Branch 6.  Review hearing scheduled for August 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jacek A Martinez in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Scheduling conference scheduled for 07-03-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jacek A Martinez in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Danielle Chojnacki for Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.
The court orders defendant have no possession of illegal drugs.

Defendant Jacek A Martinez in court with Student Intern Trisha Fritz under the supervision of attorney Debra J Patterson.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4/24/14 @ 1:30pm
